sense.name: Gain points in a game or contest.
sense.commentary: NP1[team or team member] SCORE NP2[point value]
sense.examples: The home team scored many times. He scored a home run. He scored .300 in the past season.

sense.name: Make marks in the surface of.
sense.examples: The artist scored the pieces before fusing them into the finished pot. Scoring the wood can help the glue adhere.

sense.name: Make underscoring marks for a piece of music.
Write a musical score for.
sense.examples: John scored his magnum opus for slide whistle and kazoo choir. I'm scoring a piece of music tonight. Teodulo Mabellini's ``Lux aeterna'' was intriguingly scored for tonight's performance.

sense.name: Have sex with.
sense.examples: Sally finally scored Harry. Did you score last night? Harry scored Sally.

sense.name: Attain or assign points in an academic setting.
sense.examples: She scored high on the SAT. He scored a 200 on the GRE. I have to score these tests tonight. He got paid to score the SAT essays. Score the homeworks and return them by this afternoon.

sense.name: Rub away as in erasing or as if by erasing.
sense.examples: Score out the marks on the board.

sense.name: Receive or achieve
sense.commentary: NOTE: This sense applies to illegal and legal activities.
sense.examples: He scored some pot last night. I totally scored ten bucks from the horse race. The gunner scored a hit directly to the boats hull.
